movies.title: Lady Chatterley's Lover
movies.plot: A film adaptation of D.H. Lawrence's novel. After a crippling injury leaves her husband impotent, Lady Chatterly is torn between her love for her husband and her physical desires. With her husband's consent, she seeks out other means of fulfilling her needs.
movies.simplePlot: A film adaptation of D.H. Lawrence's novel. After a crippling injury leaves her husband impotent, Lady Chatterly is torn between her love for her husband and her physical desires. With her ...

biography.bio: Sylvia Kristel was born on September 28, 1952 in Utrecht, Netherlands. She first came to international attention in the early 1970s with Emmanuelle (1974) for director Just Jaeckin. Then two more sequels followed in which she also starred. Included in her credits are a long list of European films including the film Julia (1974), in which she played the lead. In 1979, she came to Hollywood, appearing in The Concorde... Airport '79 (1979) for producer Jennings Lang, who also featured her in the comedy film The Nude Bomb (1980). However, this was all a prelude to the most successful film in Kristel's career -- Private Lessons (1981) -- in which she played the housekeeper who initiates 15-year-old Eric Brown to the wonders of sex. The film grossed over $50,000,000 worldwide. The Dutch actress, who speaks four languages (Dutch, English, Italian and French), now made her home in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Sylvia Kristel died at age 60 of cancer in her sleep on October 18, 2012.
biography.name: Sylvia Kristel

biography.bio: Born in London, Shane Briant topped the Law School at Trinity College in Dublin, Ireland. Nominated by the London theatre critics as "Best Newcomer" in 1971, Briant has appeared in 32 features worldwide, most notably The Picture of Dorian Gray (1973), The Naked Civil Servant (1975), La chevauchée de feu (1987), John Huston's The MacKintosh Man (1973) and Lady Chatterley's Lover (1981). He is also a novelist, having had five books published in Australia: "The Webber Agenda", "The Chasen Catalyst", "Hitkids", "Bite of the Lotus" and his new best-selling thriller, "Graphic", which came out in 2005. The short film he wrote in 2005, A Message from Fallujah (2005), won "Best in the Fest" at the Los Angeles International Short Film Festival, and many other awards. He lives in Sydney, Australia, with his wife and cats. (sbriant@bigpond.net.au)
biography.name: Shane Briant

biography.bio: Nicholas Clay was born on September 18, 1946 in London, England as Nicholas Anthony Phillip Clay. He was an actor, known for Excalibur (1981), Evil Under the Sun (1982) and L'odyssée (1997). He was married to Lorna Heilbron . He died on May 25, 2000 in London.
biography.name: Nicholas Clay

biography.bio: Ann Mitchell was born on April 22, 1939 in Stepney, London, England as Ann E. Mitchell. She is an actress, known for EastEnders (1985), The Deep Blue Sea (2011) and Lady Chatterley's Lover (1981).
biography.name: Ann Mitchell

biography.bio: Elizabeth Spriggs was born on September 18, 1929 in Buxton, Derbyshire, England as Elizabeth Jean Williams. She was an actress and writer, known for Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (2001), Sense and Sensibility (1995) and Shine on Harvey Moon (1982). She was married to Murray Manson, Kenneth Spriggs and Marshall Jones. She died on July 2, 2008 in Oxford, Oxfordshire, England.
biography.name: Elizabeth Spriggs

biography.bio: Pascale Rivault was born on October 13, 1950. She is an actress and production manager, known for The Beast (1975), Lady Chatterley's Lover (1981) and Five Women for the Killer (1974).
biography.name: Pascale Rivault

biography.bio: Peter Bennett was born on September 17, 1917 in Chelsea, London, England. He was an actor, known for Tarka the Otter (1979), Lady Chatterley's Lover (1981) and Tobias and the Angel (1947). He was married to Sheila Bramwell-Jones. He died on December 23, 1989 in London.
biography.name: Peter Bennett

biography.bio: Anthony Stewart Head was born on February 20, 1954 in Camden Town, north London, England. He grew up in Hampton, near Richmond upon Thames in London. He's the youngest son of his parents, Seafield Head (a documentary filmmaker) and Helen Shingler (an actress). He is the younger brother of musical actor Murray Head who originated the role of Judas on the original album of 'Jesus Christ Superstar'. His long term partner is former theatre administrator Sarah Fisher who he met when he was 28, and they are the parents of actresses Emily Head and Daisy Head. Besides acting, Head takes after his brother in being an accomplished singer, and they have appeared in many of the same productions, although never at the same time. In 1983, he was in a band named "Two Way". The band released a 45 single with three songs, produced by Richard Dodd and Ron Roker. Head's other skills are: horse riding, swimming, scuba diving, piano, guitar and stage fighting.
biography.name: Anthony Head

biography.bio: Frank Moorey was born on November 23, 1936 in Blackburn, Lancashire, England. He was an actor, known for Love Actually (2003), Lady Chatterley's Lover (1981) and Trial by Fire (1999). He was married to Stefa Gabrielle Wastie (stage name Gabrielle Laye). He died on November 20, 2003 in Brighton, Sussex, England.
biography.name: Frank Moorey

biography.bio: Bessie Love was born in Texas. Her cowboy father moved the family to Hollywood, where he became a chiropractor. As the family needed money, Bessie's mother sent her to Biograph Studios, hoping she would become an actress. D.W. Griffith saw she was pretty and had some acting talent, and put her in several of his films, also giving her a small part in Intolerance: Love's Struggle Throughout the Ages (1916). Bessie became popular with audiences and worked with Douglas Fairbanks in Reggie Mixes In (1916) and William S. Hart in The Aryan (1916). She then moved to Vitagraph and starred in a number of comedy-dramas. In the 1920s she began to act in more mature roles, such as Those Who Dance (1924), and also began working on the stage. She performed the first screen "Charleston" dance in The King on Main Street (1925), and gave one of her best performances in Dress Parade (1927). When sound movies came into vogue, she made a number of them and received an Academy Award nomination for The Broadway Melody (1929). By 1931, however, her career was over. She moved to England in 1935 and entertained the troops during World War II. By the 1950s she started playing small roles in movies such as No Highway in the Sky (1951). She played in a handful of low-budget films from the 1950s through the 1970s. In the 1980s she appeared in the big-budget Ragtime (1981) which starred James Cagney, and later that year in Reds (1981) which starred Warren Beatty.
biography.name: Bessie Love

biography.bio: John Tynan is an actor, known for Lady Chatterley's Lover (1981).
biography.name: John Tynan

biography.bio: Michael Huston is an actor, known for Lady Chatterley's Lover (1981) and Ed's Next Move (1996).
biography.name: Michael Huston

biography.bio: Fran Hunter is known for her work on Croupier (1998), Give My Regards to Broad Street (1984) and Mind Games (2001).
biography.name: Fran Hunter

biography.bio: Michael Ryan is an actor, known for It (1990), White Noise 2: The Light (2007) and The Perfect Score (2004).
biography.name: Michael Ryan

biography.bio: Son of American actor Bonar Colleano (1924 - 1958), who died in a tragic road accident in England, and British Rank starlet Susan Shaw (1929 - 1978). An Irish ancestor (boxer) named Sullivan emigrated to Australia, from which came the Colleano (alias) Brothers, who were circus and Vaudevillain performers early in the century. His grandmother (mother of Bonar), a contortionist, became Mark's legal guardian and raised him in Kensington, England, UK. Mostly known for his work as a child and teenager actor.
biography.name: Mark Colleano

filmingLocations.location: Wrotham Park, Barnet, Hertfordshire, England, UK
